thread.title: Port picketing to continue for fifth day
thread.title_full: Port picketing to continue for fifth day

title: Port picketing to continue for fifth day
text:
Tue, Aug 11, 2015, 9:05 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets open in 55 mins. Port picketing to continue for fifth day AAP – 3 hours ago Print 
Protests against the late-night sacking of port workers by text message and email will continue for the fifth day despite orders to cease industrial action. 
During the past four days hundreds of workers have gathered at ports in Brisbane and Sydney run by Hutchison Ports Australia, after 97 of the company's 224 dock workers were told on Thursday night that their employment had ended. 
The Fair Work Commission held a hearing into the sackings in Sydney on Monday night and Deputy President Anna Booth ordered an end to the picketing. 
"It is the expectation of Hutchison Ports Australia that all forms of industrial actions will cease immediately and the Maritime Union of Australia will ensure that the order is complied with," HPA chief financial officer Chee Keong Chan said in a statement. 
But an MUA spokesman said picketing would continue on Tuesday. 
Hutchison Ports has said the job cuts are part of a move to downsize and due to financial losses, but the MUA claims the company wants to replace workers with machines. 
Hutchison Ports cut power to the Brisbane picket line on Monday morning, but at least 29 different unions supporting the protesters provided food, tents, generators and portable toilets. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Rent rises slowest on record: RP Data AAP 
Home prices might be rising at a record pace but it's good news for tenants - rent growth has slowed to its weakest …
